verbs.description: as [ARG0: states] [V: scramble] [ARG1: to find execution drugs] experts say it time to let lethal injection die it is n't more humane than antiquated methods — it just easier to watch the pain it inflicts or revisit the killing machines of the past — and potentially face a public outcry that may just hasten the practice demise delaware senate washington supreme court dylann roof supreme court of the united states joel zivot university of michigan journal of law reform cisatracurium diazepam mississippi william timmons robert dunham oklahoma fentanyl pew research center deborah denno prosecutor fordham university gov pete ricketts congress carey dean moore u s utah washington supreme court director lethal injection senator j peter ricketts professor emory university sonia sotomayor nebraska james earl reed south carolina charleston alabama
